page.title: 01AN INTRODUCTION TO BROUGHTON
page.content: OUR RECTANGLE IS MADE MOSTLY OF FARMLAND. THE MAIN ROAD THAT PASSES THROUGH OUR RECTANGLE IS THE A43.IT RUNS NORTH TO SOUTH FROM NORTHAMPTON TO KETTERING.THE VILLAGE OF BROUGHTON LIES ON THAT ROAD IN THE NORTH-EASTERN PART OF THE RECTANGLE.BROUGHTON IS ABOUT1000 YEARS OLD.IT WAS MENTIONED IN THE DOMESDAY BOOK WHERE IT WAS CALLED BURTONE.IT WAS ALSO ONCE CALLED BROWETON OR BROUTON. IT NOW COVERS AN AREA OF 1000 HECTARES.THE POPULATION IS 1,422 PEOPLE, ACCORDING TO THE 1981 CENSUS.KETTERING IS ABOUT 2 MILES TO THE NORTH-EAST. THE VILLAGEÂ£S MAIN FEATURES ARE ST.ANDREW'S PARISH CHURCH,THE PRIMARY SCHOOL,TWO PUBS, A WORKING MENÂ£S CLUB, A FEW SHOPS,TWO GARAGES AND A NEW BYPASS.THERE ARE A MIXTURE OF HOUSES,OLD AND NEW.THERE ARE TWO PARKS AND A SPORTS FIELD WITH A VILLAGE HALL.
